overview: From 2025-06-15 to 2025-06-22, elizaos/eliza had 12 new PRs (9 merged), 1 new issues, and 10 active contributors.

topIssues.title: /api/agents/{agentId}/rooms -> API endpoint not found
topIssues.author: exitsimulation
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am trying to call the /rooms endpoint on my existing agent and getting a 404:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57206b48-f124-4937-98ba-5914f9e6ca59)

Here you can see that this particular agent exists:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/53b4ace7-4801-497a-ace1-f8dee3569d6d)

I am on version 1.0.9

**To Reproduce**

Create agent, try to GET or POST /rooms on the agendId endpoint

**Expected behavior**

I was expecting to retrieve the rooms of the agent

**Screenshots**

(see above)

** Additional Context **

Both /logs and /memories on this particular agentId are working. Just /rooms returns the 404 "API endpoint not found" on both POST and GET
`http://localhost:3000/api/agents/b8af647b-f617-0ae3-ab07-acb81861d7e2/rooms`

topIssues.title: Plugin list in GUI settings displays duplicates

topIssues.body: Make sure eliza/postman specs are upto date with latest implementation of server/apis

topPRs.title: feat: Split server package from CLI (continued shaw's PR)
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- Split server functionality into separate `@elizaos/server` package
- Maintains full backward compatibility with existing CLI integrations
- Enables independent usage of server components
- Updated all CLI imports to use the new server package

## Test plan
- [x] All existing CLI tests pass
- [x] Server package builds and exports correctly
- [x] Backward compatibility maintained
- [x] Integration tests verify CLI + server work together
- [x] Type safety preserved across package boundaries

Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

topPRs.title: Add server, add tests
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR adds detailed tests to core, server, project-starter and plugin-starter

Project-starter and plugin-starter have had frontends added with cypress testing, to make frontend development easier and more clear

topPRs.title: chore: strict cli, fix types
topPRs.author: ChristopherTrimboli
topPRs.body:
This pull request focuses on improving error handling, updating dependencies, and making minor refactorings across the `packages/cli` codebase. The most significant changes enhance robustness by ensuring error messages are properly handled, introduce new dependencies for functionality, and refine existing code to improve readability and maintainability.

### Error Handling Improvements:
* Updated error handling across multiple files to ensure proper type-checking for `Error` instances before accessing their `message` property. This avoids runtime errors when non-`Error` objects are caught. Examples include `crud.ts`, `lifecycle.ts`, and `plugins/actions/install.ts`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-65ee1a47f0dad046d74f3b8b3178ba6c412670b0f3dab276130f97b0f2e976daL108-R121) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-07e7f09f22fb90e9c8e7832124242ff9f5f1812f7eadf4a9e8368a170185030dL90-R92) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-26629e3c6530578685ceac73c4b7b4b2fbbc4db0bb5cff9a51e92fced536d285L96-R100)
* Enhanced error handling in plugin-related actions, such as `removePlugin` and `upgradePlugin`, to account for edge cases and improve logging clarity. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-a52e7e99b70813b752b2f4af92cdefba30488bdc01bd6e4a212c621ffc67e188L72-R92) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-76b38489feb5ff5591edb08ee6e61fc6ffa802aa05689f158ca4281a8939aa91L43-R43)

### Dependency Updates:
* Added new dependencies `bun-types` and `inquirer` to `packages/cli/package.json` for improved type support and interactive CLI functionality. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6e2e2a1851648938b325ba84de634407a4e69a644ea61102df15ca4a8a7a9758R55) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6e2e2a1851648938b325ba84de634407a4e69a644ea61102df15ca4a8a7a9758R102)
* Updated the package version from `1.0.6` to `1.0.9` in `packages/cli/package.json`.

### Code Refinements:
* Replaced direct property access with optional chaining (`?.`) in various places to prevent errors when accessing potentially undefined values, such as in `resetEnv` and `generatePlugin`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6ca7f20d124a2819dde208db201d5d2e5fb9e00bbeab034ca8496adca7a4451fL96-R98) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-763fbf7fc3635b684892f80902191b6384a61b83317684a42148b6b3f1468b8dL61-R63)
* Simplified the `plugins` command definition by replacing `function` with an arrow function for better readability.

### Minor Refactorings:
* Removed unused imports, such as `path` in `create/index.ts` and `ApiResponse` in `utils/validation.ts`, to clean up the codebase. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-e85db3b9733aa67073e3397b203523dcd174b6a7b2ee32e2ef6e53933e9b9451L3) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-7d4919506d11f397603bfab6de3c32d3243ab311877623b5db6bd8840f871ba3L3-R3)
* Improved logging in utility functions, such as `parseEnvFile` and `writeEnvFile`, to handle errors more gracefully. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-788946e003816b7529bd6a2e80227caa83b000960054d3868594e69dc7a3370bL44-R46) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-788946e003816b7529bd6a2e80227caa83b000960054d3868594e69dc7a3370bL67-R71)

topPRs.title: ui: apply design system to agent creator forms
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- Applied consistent design system to agent creator forms and tabs
- Updated character-form component with dark theme styling using existing sidebar CSS variables
- Implemented tab styling similar to agent-sidebar with proper focus states
- Added section headers with clean typography and spacing

## Changes
- **character-form.tsx**: Updated tabs, form inputs, labels, and layout styling
- **array-input.tsx**: Applied design system to tag input component
- Used `bg-sidebar-background`, `border-sidebar-border`, `text-sidebar-foreground` for consistency
- Applied `rounded-none` throughout to match design specifications
- Added proper focus states with accent color `#3B82F6`

## Test plan
- [ ] Verify agent creator forms display with dark theme styling
- [ ] Check that all form inputs use consistent colors and borders
- [ ] Confirm tabs have proper active/hover states
- [ ] Test array inputs work correctly with new styling
- [ ] Ensure all text is properly readable with contrast

completedItems.title: fix bootstrap evaluator callbacks
completedItems.body:
Evaluator callbacks seem unhandled.

This PR forwards the callback handler to `runtime.evaluate()` in favor of passing an empty closure
